column4: Hello, anybody knows if Ubuntu works well with all the components of the new dell XPS 14z laptop: http://www.dell.com/us/p/xps-l412z/pd?~ck=mn -- it has an NVIDIA GeForce GT 520M with Optimus -- is this something that would work with nvidia drivers in ubuntu?
considering buying it, that's why i'm asking :-)
there are some projects to do optimus out there, search for them. You're in need of a lot of reading. I do think you're in luck though because the projects have been around for a couple months
its two graphics chips on the same machine, in windows they dynamically switch between the two chips. in linux you have to manually do it
ok, i see

yeah so you would run your main environment on the intel card, because intel works really nice for unity and gnome-shell. then you could use the cli to launch certain apps and tell them to use your nvidia card
from what I gather
hmm ok
so really the nvidia card wouldn't be used that much
yeah it wouldnt be, some bios let you force intel OR nvidia
you could choose
I see
I plan to buy one someone soon. I'll probably just use intel all the time, its less power hungry and it has very good driver support
you were planning on buying the xps 14z?
I prefer Fedora for my desktop/laptop because I like gnome-shell. however I still use ubuntu on my servers
ok, couldn't you use gnome-shell in ubuntu or debian though?
im not sure, I kind of want one of the newer ultrabooks... i just figure they will all come with Intel/Nvidia optimus crap
i think so, however ubuntu keeps changing so many things each release without documenting why... mainly the things that are not integrating with upstream.. that I just choose fedora
yeh, the newer ultrabooks are too thin for me though, they'd fly away on my lap in my backyard :-P
i'm probably speaking blasphemy here
what's the advantage of fedora? :-P I'd miss the "Debian" way of organizing things a bit, especially after taking great pains learning it
I would just check it out, fedora is a very nice system if you know linux. It's not as ready for non-linux people as ubuntu is. but it is quite nice
ok, thanks :-)
if you want, msg me in private and I will give you my email. I can help you settle into fedora from that
